commands.name: about
commands.description: Displays information about the current project
commands.help: Displays information about the current project

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: help
commands.description: Displays help for a command
commands.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:

  <info>bin/console help list</info>

You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>bin/console help --format=xml list</info>

To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

format.name: --format
format.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: list
commands.description: Lists commands
commands.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:

  <info>bin/console list</info>

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

  <info>bin/console list test</info>

You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>bin/console list --format=xml</info>

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

  <info>bin/console list --raw</info>

format.name: --format
format.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

commands.name: assets:install
commands.description: Installs bundles web assets under a public web directory
commands.help:
The <info>assets:install</info> command installs bundle assets into a given
directory (e.g. the <comment>web</comment> directory).

  <info>bin/console assets:install web</info>

A "bundles" directory will be created inside the target directory and the
"Resources/public" directory of each bundle will be copied into it.

To create a symlink to each bundle instead of copying its assets, use the
<info>--symlink</info> option (will fall back to hard copies when symbolic links aren't possible:

  <info>bin/console assets:install web --symlink</info>

To make symlink relative, add the <info>--relative</info> option:

  <info>bin/console assets:install web --symlink --relative</info>

symlink.name: --symlink
symlink.description: Symlinks the assets instead of copying it

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: cache:clear
commands.description: Clears the cache
commands.help:
The <info>cache:clear</info> command clears the application cache for a given environment
and debug mode:

  <info>bin/console cache:clear --env=dev</info>
  <info>bin/console cache:clear --env=prod --no-debug</info>

no-warmup.name: --no-warmup
no-warmup.description: Do not warm up the cache

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: cache:pool:clear
commands.description: Clears cache pools
commands.help:
The <info>cache:pool:clear</info> command clears the given cache pools or cache pool clearers.

    bin/console cache:pool:clear <cache pool or clearer 1> [...<cache pool or clearer N>]

pools.name: pools
pools.description: A list of cache pools or cache pool clearers

commands.name: cache:warmup
commands.description: Warms up an empty cache
commands.help:
The <info>cache:warmup</info> command warms up the cache.

Before running this command, the cache must be empty.

This command does not generate the classes cache (as when executing this
command, too many classes that should be part of the cache are already loaded
in memory). Use <comment>curl</comment> or any other similar tool to warm up
the classes cache if you want.

verbose.name: --verbose

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: config:dump-reference
commands.description: Dumps the default configuration for an extension
commands.help:
The <info>config:dump-reference</info> command dumps the default configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

  <info>bin/console config:dump-reference framework</info>
  <info>bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle</info>

With the <info>--format</info> option specifies the format of the configuration,
this is either <comment>yaml</comment> or <comment>xml</comment>.
When the option is not provided, <comment>yaml</comment> is used.

  <info>bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle --format=xml</info>

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument (only available for the yaml format):

  <info>bin/console config:dump-reference framework profiler.matcher</info>

name.name: name
name.description: The Bundle name or the extension alias

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: debug:config
commands.description: Dumps the current configuration for an extension
commands.help:
The <info>debug:config</info> command dumps the current configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

  <info>bin/console debug:config framework</info>
  <info>bin/console debug:config FrameworkBundle</info>

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument:

  <info>bin/console debug:config framework serializer.enabled</info>

name.name: name
name.description: The bundle name or the extension alias

commands.name: debug:container
commands.description: Displays current services for an application
commands.help:
The <info>debug:container</info> command displays all configured <comment>public</comment> services:

  <info>bin/console debug:container</info>

To get specific information about a service, specify its name:

  <info>bin/console debug:container validator</info>

To see available types that can be used for autowiring, use the <info>--types</info> flag:

  <info>bin/console debug:container --types</info>

By default, private services are hidden. You can display all services by
using the <info>--show-private</info> flag:

  <info>bin/console debug:container --show-private</info>

Use the --tags option to display tagged <comment>public</comment> services grouped by tag:

  <info>bin/console debug:container --tags</info>

Find all services with a specific tag by specifying the tag name with the <info>--tag</info> option:

  <info>bin/console debug:container --tag=form.type</info>

Use the <info>--parameters</info> option to display all parameters:

  <info>bin/console debug:container --parameters</info>

Display a specific parameter by specifying its name with the <info>--parameter</info> option:

  <info>bin/console debug:container --parameter=kernel.debug</info>

show-private.name: --show-private
show-private.description: Used to show public *and* private services

show-arguments.name: --show-arguments
show-arguments.description: Used to show arguments in services

tag.name: --tag
tag.description: Shows all services with a specific tag

tags.name: --tags
tags.description: Displays tagged services for an application

parameter.name: --parameter
parameter.description: Displays a specific parameter for an application

types.name: --types
types.description: Displays types (classes/interfaces) available in the container

commands.name: debug:event-dispatcher
commands.description: Displays configured listeners for an application
commands.help:
The <info>debug:event-dispatcher</info> command displays all configured listeners:

  <info>bin/console debug:event-dispatcher</info>

To get specific listeners for an event, specify its name:

  <info>bin/console debug:event-dispatcher kernel.request</info>

commands.name: debug:translation
commands.description: Displays translation messages information
commands.help:
The <info>debug:translation</info> command helps finding unused or missing translation
messages and comparing them with the fallback ones by inspecting the
templates and translation files of a given bundle or the app folder.

You can display information about bundle translations in a specific locale:

  <info>bin/console debug:translation en AcmeDemoBundle</info>

You can also specify a translation domain for the search:

  <info>bin/console debug:translation --domain=messages en AcmeDemoBundle</info>

You can only display missing messages:

  <info>bin/console debug:translation --only-missing en AcmeDemoBundle</info>

You can only display unused messages:

  <info>bin/console debug:translation --only-unused en AcmeDemoBundle</info>

You can display information about app translations in a specific locale:

  <info>bin/console debug:translation en</info>

You can display information about translations in all registered bundles in a specific locale:

  <info>bin/console debug:translation --all en</info>

bundle.name: bundle
bundle.description: The bundle name or directory where to load the messages, defaults to app/Resources folder

all.name: --all
all.description: Load messages from all registered bundles

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: lint:xliff
commands.description: Lints a XLIFF file and outputs encountered errors
commands.help:
The <info>lint:xliff</info> command lints a XLIFF file and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validates XLIFF contents passed from STDIN:

  <info>cat filename | bin/console lint:xliff</info>

You can also validate the syntax of a file:

  <info>bin/console lint:xliff filename</info>

Or of a whole directory:

  <info>bin/console lint:xliff dirname</info>
  <info>bin/console lint:xliff dirname --format=json</info>

Or find all files in a bundle:

  <info>bin/console lint:xliff @AcmeDemoBundle</info>

filename.name: filename
filename.description: A file or a directory or STDIN

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: lint:yaml
commands.description: Lints a file and outputs encountered errors
commands.help:
The <info>lint:yaml</info> command lints a YAML file and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validates YAML contents passed from STDIN:

  <info>cat filename | bin/console lint:yaml</info>

You can also validate the syntax of a file:

  <info>bin/console lint:yaml filename</info>

Or of a whole directory:

  <info>bin/console lint:yaml dirname</info>
  <info>bin/console lint:yaml dirname --format=json</info>

Or find all files in a bundle:

  <info>bin/console lint:yaml @AcmeDemoBundle</info>

commands.name: multikernel:convert
commands.description: Converts a project to a multikernel project
commands.help:
The <info>multikernel:convert</info> command changes the filesystem
structure of a Symfony Standard Edition project to a multikernel project.

The command is only available on a regular app kernel and is disabled
after conversion.

To convert your project to a multikernel project, run:

  <info>bin/console multikernel:convert</info>

After converting the project filesystem structure, run:

  <info>composer dump-autoload</info>
  <info>composer symfony-scripts</info>

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: server:log
commands.description: Starts a log server that displays logs in real time
commands.help:
<info>server:log</info> starts a log server to display in real time the log
messages generated by your application:

  <info>bin/console server:log</info>

To get the information as a machine readable format, use the
<comment>--filter</> option:

<info>bin/console server:log --filter=port</info>

filter.name: --filter
filter.description: An expression to filter log. Example: "level > 200 or channel in ['app', 'doctrine']"

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: server:run
commands.description: Runs a local web server
commands.help:
<info>server:run</info> runs a local web server: By default, the server
listens on <comment>127.0.0.1</> address and the port number is automatically selected
as the first free port starting from <comment>8000</>:

  <info>bin/console server:run</info>

This command blocks the console. If you want to run other commands, stop it by
pressing <comment>Control+C</> or use the non-blocking <comment>server:start</>
command instead.

Change the default address and port by passing them as an argument:

  <info>bin/console server:run 127.0.0.1:8080</info>

Use the <info>--docroot</info> option to change the default docroot directory:

  <info>bin/console server:run --docroot=htdocs/</info>

Specify your own router script via the <info>--router</info> option:

  <info>bin/console server:run --router=app/config/router.php</info>

See also: http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php

addressport.name: addressport
addressport.description: The address to listen to (can be address:port, address, or port)

docroot.name: --docroot
docroot.description: Document root, usually where your front controllers are stored

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: server:start
commands.description: Starts a local web server in the background
commands.help:
<info>server:start</info> runs a local web server: By default, the server
listens on <comment>127.0.0.1</> address and the port number is automatically selected
as the first free port starting from <comment>8000</>:

  <info>bin/console server:start</info>

The server is run in the background and you can keep executing other commands.
Execute <comment>server:stop</> to stop it.

Change the default address and port by passing them as an argument:

  <info>bin/console server:start 127.0.0.1:8080</info>

Use the <info>--docroot</info> option to change the default docroot directory:

  <info>bin/console server:start --docroot=htdocs/</info>

Specify your own router script via the <info>--router</info> option:

  <info>bin/console server:start --router=app/config/router.php</info>

See also: http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php

addressport.name: addressport
addressport.description: The address to listen to (can be address:port, address, or port)

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: server:status
commands.description: Outputs the status of the local web server for the given address
commands.help:
<info>server:status</info> shows the details of the given local web
server, such as the address and port where it is listening to:

  <info>bin/console server:status</info>

To get the information as a machine readable format, use the
<comment>--filter</> option:

<info>bin/console server:status --filter=port</info>

Supported values are <comment>port</>, <comment>host</>, and <comment>address</>.

filter.name: --filter
filter.description: The value to display (one of port, host, or address)

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: server:stop
commands.description: Stops the local web server that was started with the server:start command
commands.help:
<info>server:stop</info> stops the local web server:

  <info>bin/console server:stop</info>

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: translation:update
commands.description: Updates the translation file
commands.help:
The <info>translation:update</info> command extracts translation strings from templates
of a given bundle or the app folder. It can display them or merge the new ones into the translation files.

When new translation strings are found it can automatically add a prefix to the translation
message.

Example running against a Bundle (AcmeBundle)
  <info>bin/console translation:update --dump-messages en AcmeBundle</info>
  <info>bin/console translation:update --force --prefix="new_" fr AcmeBundle</info>

Example running against app messages (app/Resources folder)
  <info>bin/console translation:update --dump-messages en</info>
  <info>bin/console translation:update --force --prefix="new_" fr</info>

bundle.name: bundle
bundle.description: The bundle name or directory where to load the messages, defaults to app/Resources folder

no-prefix.name: --no-prefix
no-prefix.description: If set, no prefix is added to the translations

dump-messages.name: --dump-messages
dump-messages.description: Should the messages be dumped in the console

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question
